meanings.definition: The practice, conscious or otherwise, of placing a masculine point of view at the center of one's worldview.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, androcentrisms dominate decision-making processes.
meanings.sent2: Her essay highlighted the prevalence of androcentrisms in historical narratives.

meanings.definition: The belief that the male perspective is superior to the female perspective.
meanings.sent1: Androcentrisms can lead to unfair treatment of women in various fields.
meanings.sent2: Her speech challenged the androcentrisms deeply rooted in society.
meanings.sent3: The androcentrisms in the fairy tale were so exaggerated, it became comical.

meanings.definition: The tendency to prioritize male experiences and values over those of females.
meanings.sent1: Androcentrisms in education often overlook the needs of female students.
meanings.sent2: The androcentrisms in the literature reflected societal biases of the time.
